text: Christina Elizabeth "Dixie" Dunbar (January 19, 1919 – August 29, 1991) was an American singer and film actress.Green p.50 During the 1930s she appeared in a number of Twentieth Century Fox films, including two Jones Family films. ==Selected filmography== * George While's Scandal (1934) * Educating Father (1936) * Sing, Baby, Sing (1936) * One in a Million (1936) * King of Burlesque (1936) * Pigskin Parade (1936) * Sing and Be Happy (1937) * Walking Down Broadway (1938) * Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm (1938) * Alexander's Ragtime Band (1938) ==References== ==Bibliography== * Green, Stanley. Hollywood Musicals Year by Year. Hal Leonard Corporation, 1999. ==External links== * * * Category:1919 births Category:1991 deaths Category:American film actresses Category:20th-century American singers Category:Disease-related deaths in Florida Category:Actresses from Montgomery, Alabama Category:Musicians from Montgomery, Alabama Category:20th-century American women singers Category:20th-century American actresses
title: Dixie Dunbar
